intro: Diplotaxis ollivieri var. micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved synandry, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, also known as the mustard family, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and slender, branching stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are clustered in racemes. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
